meanings.definition: Feeling or expressing great happiness or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The children were woopy when they found out school was canceled due to snow.
meanings.sent2: She had a woopy smile on her face after receiving the good news.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's woopy tail wagging showed how happy he was to see his owner.
meanings.sent4: The woopy colors of the sunset painted the sky in a joyful light.
meanings.sent5: The woopy laughter of the baby filled the room with pure joy.

meanings.definition: A sound made to express joy or excitement.
meanings.sent1: The crowd erupted in a woopy cheer when their team scored a goal.
meanings.sent2: The children's woopy laughter echoed through the playground.
meanings.sent3: The woopy of the fireworks lit up the night sky with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The woopy of the balloons popping added to the festive atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The woopy of the music filled the room with energy and happiness.
